resources.string: Culture cell image to be analised
Button for marking cells releasing content
Button for removing marks over cells
Button for removing the whole marks

Aiming to mark cells, select the proper marking icon (alive, dead, not sure, releasing content) and touch on the cell to be marked. In order to remove the mark, either use removal button (one at a time) or all of them through the last button.

Push on the arrow at the bottom part to move to the next step or complete the task.

Further info at socientize.eu.

Cells that die by apoptosis get rounded first, and then they shrink as the membrane blebs. The nucleus shrinks and might also get fragmented. If the cell dies by necrosis, it usually keeps its shape and size. However, the major characteristic of necrosis is cell content release (cytosol) which is observed as one or several bubbles growing up around the cell. If nothing of the abovementioned happens, it is likely an alive cell.\n\nFurther info at socientize.eu.

Cell content release is observed as transparent bubbles around the cells. They can grow starting at several positions in the cell perimeter. Cell content release without a significant change in the overall morphology of the cell is indicative of death by necrosis.\n\nFurther information at socientize.eu.
Marked cells in this step is greater than the previous one, they should be less or equal
